page.title: 02VILLAGE LIFE(BOLAM)
page.content: { Bolam}is a small hamlet 2 miles off the A68 Darlington Road ,2 miles South of West Auckland.The population of 75 people is divided approxamatly into 3 sections,farming,people who work in the nearest big town (Darlington)and old retired people. In{Bolam}life is quiet.Gardening is very popular because of the large amount of land around each house.There is no school,playing area,shops, doctors or vets in the village. They are all 3 miles down the road at Ingleton.St.Andrews Chapel,at the edge of the village,has two services a month one on the first Sunday that is Holy Communion and on the afternoon of the third Sunday Even-Song is held. There are two buses one on Monday and one on Saturday they both go to Darlington.There also is a traveling library that comes once a fortnight.
